intro: Boechera perennans subsp. perennans, commonly known as the perennial rockcress, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that typically reaches heights of 5–15 cm. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters during the spring and early summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or arctic regions.
